snippet.title: Let's Play - Gunny Bunny - Mice Murder
snippet.description:
Yes, I am completely silent after the introduction.

This is an awesome little flash rail-shooter that I found many years ago (probably 2003, when it was released) and fell in love with. It's one of the few flash games I've played that uses 3D models to good effect, not to mention the awesome music and sound effects. Though when I first played it, I was on a crappy iMac and it ran so slow that it was impossible to lose; so it poses a bit more of a challenge than I remember.

A few things I want to mention about the game:
- You'll notice when I hit the take button, (L| and |R) appear, this indicates which hand the weapon you pick up will go to (once it's cycled through the other ones).
- There's a small bug when you have the shotgun equipped in your left hand in that whenever you hit take, it will fire the shotgun. (1:57)
- The "mice" use a modified Super Mario pipe sound effect when they appear from the ground, though I'm sure you noticed it too.
- You are forced to murder the fishing teddy bears before you can progress. :(

Hope you enjoyed it!
